question_title: What will be the value of "ICE BofA US High Yield Index Total Return Index Value" on 2026-02-13?
summary: Forecasting the ICE BofA US High Yield Index Total Return Value on 2026-02-13, approximately 11 trading days from the last known value of 1876.28 (Jan 29). The forecast centers near current levels with modest positive drift from carry (~6% annual yield), but with slightly asymmetric downside risk due to historically tight credit spreads (2.7% vs 4.9% 20-year average). The Fed held rates at 3.5-3.75% in January and is expected to remain on hold through March, providing a stable rate environment. Economic growth remains solid. The distribution reflects typical high yield volatility (~5-6% annualized) over the short horizon, with a mixture model accounting for 80% normal conditions, 15% mild stress, and 5% significant stress scenarios.

factors.description: Current value anchoring: Index at 1876.28 on Jan 29, 2026 with slight recent downward trend (-0.16% over 5 days). Short horizon limits expected movement.
Positive carry: ~6% annual yield provides daily drift of ~0.024%, supporting modest appreciation over 11 trading days (~+0.27% expected).
Fed on hold: Rates steady at 3.5-3.75%, expected to remain unchanged through March. Stable rate environment supports high yield.
Historically tight spreads: Credit spreads at 2.7% vs 4.9% 20-year average. Limited upside potential, asymmetric downside risk if spreads widen.
Solid economic growth: Economy expanding at solid pace per Fed assessment. Supportive of credit quality and high yield performance.
Tariff uncertainty: Some inflationary pressure expected mid-2026 from tariffs. Minor source of volatility.
